required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the AmniSure ROM Test
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the AmniSure ROM Test

brief_summary.textblock: To show that having less qualified personnel (non-Laboratory trained professionals) perform the test yields the same result as if a Laboratory trained professional performed the test.

detailed_description.textblock: The main goal of this study is to show that when performed by less qualified personnel, the AmniSure® ROM Test is so simple and accurate that the likelihood of erroneous results by the Intended-User is negligible and that the test poses no unreasonable risk of harm to the patient if performed incorrectly.

primary_outcome.measure: The evaluation the clinical performance of the AmniSure® ROM test performed by the Intended-User relative to the clinical diagnosis of rupture of membranes.
primary_outcome.time_frame: One time at time of enrollment
primary_outcome.description: The investigational AmniSure ROM test will be compared to the three standard tests of nitrazine, ferning and pooling to determine rupture of fetal membranes.

arm_group.description: Individuals with signs, symptoms or suspicion of membrane rupture at 11 to 42 weeks gestation that will receive the AmniSure ROM test.

intervention.description: Comparison of AmniSure ROM test to clinical diagnosis of ROM.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be women presenting with signs, symptoms or suspicion of membrane rupture at 11 to 42 weeks gestation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must be pregnant.
- Subjects must be between 18 and 50 years of age and have a gestational age of 11.0-42.0 weeks.
- Subjects reporting suspicion, signs, or symptoms suggestive of ROM, PROM, PPROM.
- Subjects providing informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have placenta previa.
- Subjects who have heavy vaginal bleeding.
- Subjects who have had digital vaginal examination immediately prior to evaluation for ROM.

facility.name: University of California San Francisco- Fresno
Kansas University Medical Center Research Institute, Inc
